title: Understanding Digital Communication Ecology: Cybernetics-Based Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage skills and experience accessing online platforms
context.additional_context: Learners primarily access content via smartphones, with limited digital technology experience but high exposure to everyday digital environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more key components of the digital communication ecosystem (technology, culture, social structure).
Learners can derive interaction patterns between digital systems through case analysis applying cybernetic principles.
Learners can self-assess their digital literacy level and develop an improvement plan.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
